channel.title: Comments on: Desperately Seeking Snoozinâ€™ 2: or how to help your children sleep like angels. With help from Fleetwood Mac, Dr Trevor Stevens and Wham!
channel.description: Supporting children's language, communication and learning

item.title: By: Michael Jones
item.dc:creator: Michael Jones
item.description: Thank you Mary. That is so heartening to know. I will pass your message on to Trevor Very best wishes Michael
item.content:encoded:
Thank you Mary. That is so heartening to know. I will pass your message on to Trevor
Very best wishes
Michael

item.title: By: Lizzie
item.dc:creator: Lizzie
item.description: Thank you for the recommendation of this CD. It was invaluable when babysitting for our one year old grand daughter for the first time the other night - worked like a charm, calming a very outraged young person into a sleep in very little time - brilliant!!
item.content:encoded: Thank you for the recommendation of this CD. It was invaluable when babysitting for our one year old grand daughter for the first time the other night – worked like a charm, calming a very outraged young person into a sleep in very little time – brilliant!!

item.title: By: Samantha Palmer
item.dc:creator: Samantha Palmer
item.description: Some very good advice. Would this also be appropriate for a child just turned one? I child mind and am working on some sleep issues with parents. PS I've just ordered Trevor's sleep CD and will be trying that too!
item.content:encoded:
Some very good advice. Would this also be appropriate for a child just turned one? I child mind and am working on some sleep issues with parents.
PS I’ve just ordered Trevor’s sleep CD and will be trying that too!

item.title: By: Michael Jones
item.dc:creator: Michael Jones
item.description: Thank you Rosalind You are very kind. I just couldn't believe my eyes when I saw that Wham! video. Watch out for a U2 post in the not too distant future. Best wishes Michael
item.content:encoded:
Thank you Rosalind
You are very kind. I just couldn’t believe my eyes when I saw that Wham! video.
Watch out for a U2 post in the not too distant future.
Best wishes
Michael
